title: Go After an Easy Prey
text:
Go After an Easy Prey (Chinese: 瓮中捉鳖) is a <a href="Chinese%20animation">Chinese animated</a> film in black and white from 1948. It is also referred to as "Turtle Caught in a Jar".
Translation.
The title of the film is a phrase describing something as easy to catch as a turtle. The off English translation may be "<a href="shooting%20fish%20in%20a%20barrel">shooting fish in a barrel</a>".
Background.
The film was produced by the <a href="Northeast%20Film%20Studio">Northeast Film Studio</a> during its transitional phase with the downfall of the puppet government <a href="Manchukuo">Manchukuo</a>.
Story.
The film is believed to be more of a documentary view of <a href="Chinese%20Civil%20War">China's civil war</a> in the 1940s when <a href="Chiang%20Kai-shek">Chiang Kai-shek</a> was considered to be favored and aided by U.S <a href="imperialism">imperialism</a>. He was metaphorically described as trapped like a turtle by the <a href="People%27s%20Liberation%20Army">People's Liberation Army</a>.
